pros: You feel proud to be a part of such a big brand name. Any location but Hyderabad, is great to work at. One really has to pull his/her boot up to match with the high standards.
cons: Hyderabad GE sucks. One would go dumb with all the age old technologies and people are reluctant to keep pace with the changing world. People who stay in the company for a long time (doesn't matter if they are knowledgeable or dumb) are promoted.

review_title: Very nice co-workers and a relatively relaxed work enviroment
pros:
Great management, the project managers give you adequate time to work on projects.

You can choose what time you want to come in and leave for the most part as long as you work at least eight hours a day.

You get your own office.

Opportunities for managerial and lean training are available.
cons:
Relatively low pay compared to other companies.

Raises are not a lot and do not happened very frequently.

review_title: Great company working to shed big company burdens
job_title: Global Commercial Finance Leader in Denver, CO
pros: Opportunity to work with incredibly smart people, some of the world's best leaders and sell arguably the best products in the industry.
cons: While they're working to improve upon this, the company continues to struggle with bureaucracy, slow customer response times and other a litany of non-value add requirements.

review_title: Large company pros and cons
pros: Perks of working for a large company include name recognition and some ability to move around. Compensation is average to slightly above average. There are many different groups and product lines to learn about and work for. There are many smart, valuable employees to learn from.
cons: Bureaucracy is very apparent here. Hurdles and politics that go with working for a large company can be difficult to overcome. Often employees work long hours and efforts go unnoticed. There are many confusing and inconsistent processes that dictate how you accomplish your job.

review_title: Productions Operator
pros: The Job security is great, being able to learn and continue new experiences is also a plus.  the ability to advance positions is always an option as ling as your willing to work hard for them.  being part of an organized team and having professional bosses that are willing to help with anything you need is great.
cons: the only con could be that I had to leave the company due to relocation.

review_title: Scope
job_title: Human Resources Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Variety of projects at any one time, extreme rigor and process orientation, great colleagues (really smart people) and global growth opportunities, strong affinity group presence and mentor opportunities, leadership development programs are top-notch.
cons: Political maneuvering was prevalent, weak performance management (slow to act on mediocrity, at least in my function), huge company (difficult to feel like you have an influential voice), many actively disengaged.

review_title: Amazing training
pros: Great training programs and a great place to gain experience at the beginning of one's career. Surrounding by very smart, accomplished people.
cons: It's a large company and can feel very large company. If you want to build a long career at the company, while also advancing your career forward, can require moving your family time and time again, possibly all over the world.

review_title: Pretty good company to work for
pros: Good people, lots of opportunities with the company.  Never a dull moment in such a matrixed organization!  Spent many years there from internship through full time and enjoyed it
cons: Too big for its own good.  It is very easy to get lost, and if you don't advocate for yourself really well, you can easily get lost in the shuffle

review_title: BA contractor for over 5 years
job_title: Senior Business Analyst Consultant in Stamford, CT
pros:
-Great Place to learn
-Adopter of New Technology
- Recognition and oppurtunites if you are a star performer and have a Greencard / are a US citizen
cons:
- Projects tend to  not finish on time
- Insane amount of office politics by fulltime employees
- cut throat culture
- Every day seems like a new deadline on critical projects
- Deadlines can get very stressful

review_title: Great Culture
job_title: Learning and Development Manager in Houston, TX
pros: A great place to learn and grow.  If you want to plug in and get involved there are lots of opportunities to do that.  Great training programs.  Lots of room to grow. Leaders are responsible for growing their people.
cons: It is a really big company and easy to feel like you are a really small fish.  You will need to have initiative to figure things out and jump in.  More work than time to get it done so work life balance is a challenge

review_title: Looks good on a resume
job_title: Manufacturing Engineering Specialist in Wilmington, MA
pros: Small department, good co-workers, good pay and benefits along with an interesting product made this a good place to be.
cons: Sales of our product never met their expectations. Our department was closed. They have a management program for interns to be our boss for six month intervals. Some of the worst bosses I've ever had have been while working here. Management was more about their bottom line than treating employees with respect.

review_title: Sourcing analyst
pros: Excellent coaching from the reporting managers and other senior members of the team, high level of autonomy given to the employees even if you are starting at GE.
cons: There are not really any cons that could be mentioned but maybe the culture doesnt suit some people which makes it a disadvantage for them

review_title: 10 years and counting
pros:
A wide range of extraordinarily intelligent people
Terrific infrastructure 
Global reach
Some areas are great to work with and for
Genuinely committed to diversity of gender, ethnicity, veteran status, sexual orientation, etc.
cons:
Many executives are in their roles short term just to cut a notch on their belt - it's brutal on the teams who sincerely believe in the company and projects
Over-the-top bad behaviors by senior management is allowed
Infighting and fiefdom building
Major overtime required to hit deadlines - often for months on end

review_title: Stranded
pros: Company is making strategic changes to move the business in a positive direction.  In the past opportunities to move within the company were plentiful.
cons: Frozen salaries for the past two years while the cost of living increases dramatically in this area and now I'm locked in to my current business for two more years and can't pursue other opportunities within the company, due to a pending merger.  Eliminated the 5 weeks of vacation I had earned for paying my dues for 15 years under the guise of presenting it as "unlimited vacation" which negatively impacts my career if I actually try to take any.

review_title: If you don't join directly from school you will be on the outside
job_title: Senior Finance Manager in Dallas, TX
pros: You get to work with smart people, mostly.  The pay is good but on an increase freeze.
cons: Each year the benefits get worse, pay more for less coverage and higher deductibles.  If you are an experienced professional and join be prepared to be on the outside.  From Finance you have to be an FMP and CAS to get anywhere.  GE does not value opinions or views from outside the company.

review_title: Good coorporative culture but sometimes bureaucratic
pros:
You always had the feeling that people were trying to work towards a common goal. There might have been different opinions on how to get there but there was no discussion about the end goal.
Also inverted pyramid thinking and respect for working levle employees was more developed than in other companies that I got to know.
cons: Sometimes new ideas were difficult to implement because people didn't want to change the way they were always working. This was especially a problem for new product development.

review_title: 125 year history means zilch in the current environment
pros: The culture, people, global scale and opportunities (albeit reducing) are some of the best reasons to work at General Electric.
cons: The fatigue associated with 3+ years of huge change and uncertainty about the business and individuals' roles make up a big part of the downside of working at GE (but also can lead to new opportunities for those who persevere).

review_title: Good technical work, complete lack of excitement
pros: Since GE is big, it can invest resources in working on challenging technical problems. If you find yourself in the right group, your work will be rewarding. And the company culture about taking care of their employees is excellent.
cons: GE is a typical Company with a capital C. Huge layer of middle management, plenty of people just trying to climb the ladder. As a conglomerate, it lacks focus on its products and the priorities keep shifting from year to year. This results in people constantly questioning the value of their output.

review_title: Slow growth, good experience
pros: Freedom to work on what viewed as important, exposure to lots of different manufacturing processes and capabilities. Management would allow you to try "out of the box" solutions as long as it showed a 2 year profitability return.
cons: Little to no wage growth. Good old boy mentality in management. Managers help their friends more then those who worked hard.

review_title: Great place to work
pros:
-Meritocracy,  the better you perform the more highly you are valued.
-Excellent people around you.
-Large breadth of knowledge withing company
-Great mentors are available if you take advantage of them.
-Opportunities to move between businesses
cons:
-work/life balance
-compensation is below average

You can easily work as many hours as you can spare.  This is actually encouraged. 
The beauracracy that comes with a large company is very prevalent.   Sometimes very difficult to make the right moves and decisions due to red tape and "the process".

review_title: GE is a great company to build management, quality and leadership abilities
pros:
I was very proud to work with this company.  The best part of C&I was intelligent, savvy, talented people in global environment that you felt excited to work with every day.  We always had new challenges to tackle so it was never boring.  Change was part of the culture and not something to fear - it was something to capitalize on.  Excellent processes and tools were available to complete job and function responsibilities.  We had fire fighting just as everyone does but there was also time and rewards to taking the time to blow up processes and streamline everyday responsibiities using six sigma.  There was good balance between team and individual goals and objectives.

Fantastic support was provided from GE Corporate on management training, online tools, and knowledge sharing.  Even with so much change in acquisitions and divestitures, the GE umbrella felt stable and highly respected.

Feedback was part of the culture and performance appraisals were completed on time and were reviewed by top management.  Session C data was proactively used to develop people and effectively utilize internal pipelines of talent.  Managers and executives were very open to questions and assisting in grooming the next leaders.  Opportunities were usually available for those who actively pursued them.
cons:
Learning the big GE world is a challenge and occasionally overwhelming to handle everything coming at you.  Work/life balance was sometimes nonexistent but always seemed to work out well in the end.  Pay was competitive but you must stay on the fast track for promotions to really drive salary up, otherwise the merit increases kept you whole but you never really got ahead with compression happening more than what we would have liked.  

Losing other GE businesses was hard because even though you understand the corporate strategy behind selling off the pieces, the people leaving felt like family.

review_title: General Electric Lighting -- Low Pay, High Hours, Zero Appreciation
pros: As an entry level position, the best reason to work for GE is for experience and to "Punch your Card" with a Fortune 50 Company.  If you don't mind moving, working weekends, traveling, politicizing, etc. it can be tolerable.  It's a good place to get practice advertising yourself and your accomplishments -- if you don't, you're history.  Plenty of opportunities for properly connected people willing to make sacrifices for their career.
cons: The pay is lower than comparable employers.  The political side is ridiculous.  GE engages in some borderline ethical practices.  You will not EVER be able to take all your time off -- EVER.

review_title: All depends on whose team you're on
pros: Great depth of resources available.  Opportunities for developing knowledge and new competencies.  Decent pay and benefits.  Relatively stable senior management.
cons: Very demanding in terms of work hours and intensity, with people resources tight at this time due to cost reductions.  Value of your contributions is highly dependent on your group's overall image and manager's status in the organization.

review_title: FMP Trainee - GE Capital
pros: great people and a great environment; it was refreshing to be surrounded by peers who seemed to be "at the top of their game"
cons: the environment at GE is very cutthroat - either you get it or you don't; sometimes management wasn't as understanding about the personal life-work balance, however, this varied with the manager you were assigned to work under

review_title: Good place to grow. You can succeed only if you break your butt.
pros:
Management does not micro manage. They give you the goals, its up to you to get the job done. Many times the job is what yo make it.
There are very few to no slackers at GE. Its a great opportunity to work with the best and brightest for the most part.
cons: You must be willing to go the extra mile to succeed. You will get what you put into it.

review_title: Good High tech position
pros: Not being in production environment, Good place for team work and working with Smart qualified people. State of the art equipment.
cons: At the end of the day, you could have the best relationship with your immediate supervisor, and be a great employee, but you are still just a number to the Vp's.

review_title: Integrity and Integreation at work
pros:
Core value - integrity...everything flows from there.
Stable and profitable, lots of opportunity to learn about business, marketing, finance.  
Lots of opportunity to learn and grow if you seek out the opportunity.  Lots of networking opportunities.
cons:
It's a big company - change can sometimes be slow.  Sometimes it seems like there are more reviewers and approvers than people creating and servicing a product. - keeps us safe I suppose.
Pockets of innovation, but most new growth comes from acquisition.

review_title: Large, diverse business.  Locomotives to advanced control systems.
pros: Great people, very experienced local leadership and engineering staff.  Market leading technology and GE brand makes this a stable business.  Small customer base allows for intimate technical and commercial interaction.
cons: The railroad business is very risk averse and new technologies are shunned until proven successful.  Internal battles for company funding and staffing for engineering development are brutal.

review_title: I am very fortunate to have had so many great opportunities within a short amount of time.
pros:
- Great place to learn and develop, especially as an early career professional
- Many resources are available to develop
- Team members are extremely bright, inspiring, and willing to share knowledge
- Easy to network with people from other parts and businesses of GE
cons:
- tough to be agile when so large
- harder to move up because there are many layers
- depending on your role and/or business, can start to feel very stagnant in career path
- salary is lower than competitors

review_title: Great business to get your foot in the door with GE
pros: Employees are passionate about what they do.  Strong sales teams across the US.  Great atmosphere to work in, very relaxed.  Work/Life balance is very good and management respects this.
cons: Leadership has made many poor product and investment decisions over the past 5-10 years.  Sales is responsible for EVERYTHING.  You cannot grow a business with this structure.

review_title: Management could be better
pros: The starting salary was fairly good as well as the hour flexibility and cultural diversity.  A lot of positions also offer great travel opportunites.
cons: The corporate structure tends to lead to management with very poor qualities.  Most are just yes men who only care about their careers and have blinders on when it comes to confronting difficult employees.  Health care benefits are run by a horrible HMO.

review_title: Fair wages for fair work.
pros: Pay and benefits are very competitive for engineers. Safety is priority number one on manufacturing and other activities. Owns and develops technology, even has an (albeit small) R&D department. Core business is profitable and with very high grow potential. Very high capex in the last decade.
cons: Expect to work long and hard. Working environment can be challenging and demanding. Aggressive  feedback (yelling, name calling, etc) from management at every level not uncommon. Competition from all over the world can challenge the profitability.

review_title: Leadership program to design engineer
pros:
Leadership programs, excellent training - provides a ton of resources
Interesting and hard working people
Diversity is extremely important
Good benefits, flexible working hours
Good recognition and at least in Power & Water - quality products to work on
cons:
Engineering pay is just average
Sometimes difficult to get overtime pay for long hours
Sometimes can be resource constrained
Large corporation tied to shareholders and profits - hard to push for more innovation
Outsource a lot of the "fun" work because it's cheaper

review_title: Incapable leadership put pressure on employees to achieve their goals
pros: There are some smart and intelligent people you will want to work with and learn from them. You may get good learning opportunities depending on your direct management.
cons: Engineers and other technical staff is treated like slaves. In some business units, leadership has no clue what they are doing. They put employees under pressure to achieve their goals.

review_title: Software Engineer
pros: It is a great company, they are caring and provide commendable work hours that work for you. The work is semi-challenging but never a thing that cannot be accomplished. Also the co-workers are very nice and willing to help.
cons: It is a company that has misguided change. They want to compete in the software market but they have not really decided on a solid roadmap. Leadership is dismal to customer requests and things ideas always take a U-Turn at the very least.

review_title: Intern
pros: Great company to work for they are very ethical in how they treat people and all the other workers were easy to get along with
cons: there really wasn't anything that struck me as a con at GE. I guess being ChemE and going into a place that doesn't staff many ChemE's because they don's tailor to ChemE skills you take a bit of a pay hit.

review_title: Great company
pros: 19 years of unbelievable opportunities in four countries across two continents. A meritocracy. Great leadership role models in multiple organizations. The way diverse people collaborate and build great products and outcomes are second to none.
cons: Not too many. Sometimes certain corporate initiatives get overly political and taken to the extreme to be then overwritten by a different initiative a year or two later.

review_title: flow leader
pros: Pay is "decent" , 3% automatic contributions for 401k from company,  also % match of your contribution
cons:
No support from upper management for "change" but constantly put down and scrutinized for no "changing" culture.  
Lots of "behind the scenes" actions that are kept from key players and borderline immoral 
Management is guinea pigs for cuts before rolled out to union

The list goes on.....

review_title: Fantastic company to work for
pros:
Good Pay
Good Management 
Supportive environment
Various programs
Leader Roundtables to keep you update
cons:
Matrix management, culture difference and many people ignore that.
Small task can die within loops
HR are often not aware off some key things

review_title: IT Project Manager
pros: if you like excitement - there is always change at GE.Recent focus is on GE's own cloud foundry offering. Global opportunities.
cons: work/life balance is a bit out of whack. In the past, there were lulls in the year (summer, Christmas time). Now, seems like there is so much work - that it is becoming harder to even take vacation.

review_title: Good company
job_title: Audit Associate in São Paulo, São Paulo
pros:
- Good environment to work - People are usually friendly and always want to help when its needed
- Excellent Leadership programs - Several programs to help accelerate career
- Well defined career path - You can see where you can go and how long it will take
cons:
-Because of the size of the company, bureaucracy is consistent, even after several attempts to make it simpler.
- Constant changes on leadership and acquisitions make the structure of reporting really difficult

review_title: FIELD SERVICE ENGINEER
job_title: Field Service Engineer in Seattle, WA
pros: Director of Service (DOS) and Co-workers were excellent to work with.  Many challenges working multi modalities (CT, PET, AW, and Ultrasound).  Remote support and documentation is excellent and getting better.  Overall, excellent job.
cons: No work life balance.  As most, if not all, large corporations do more with less.  A work week of 60 to 70 hours was the norm not the exception.  I choose retirement due to NO work life balance.

review_title: GE
pros: There is a Large Network of peers for knowledge sharing, flexible work hours/locations (for engineering), flexible permissive time, opportunities for travel
cons: Engineers are punished for staying in current roles. Expertise is highly valued and used, however the annual raises for an employee that stays in the same team (which people rely on) is much less than for an engineer that changes jobs.

review_title: A Family
job_title: Electrical Commissioning Engineer in Richmond, VA
pros: Commissioning Engineers are like a family, always looking out for each other and bouncing ideas and quick on-site in the moment fixes off each other
cons: Sometimes the supporting office forgets that the travelling commissioning engineers needs a lot of support and is the priority for making profits for the company.  That culture must be adhered to, as when we engineers have issues and we falter, so does the office.

review_title: Best trainer of leaders.
pros: I got exactly what I was sold when I was recruited out of college into a leadership program and my career has taken me all over the world with exciting new roles.
cons: Balance has improved since I started.  Some of the leadership at acquisitions lack GE's values.  The travel is a necessary part of the job that is more positive than not.

review_title: Great introduction into the corporate world
pros: You get to work with great people who have a strong work ethic. There is the opportunity for gaining experience in many different types of engineering jobs--from the design side to the product maintenance, innovation, etc.
cons: The work is demanding--if you don't enjoy what you do, it could be rough. Enjoy engineering, and it isn't as bad!

review_title: Great learning experience in some things, boring in others
pros: It looks great on your resume, and the company is really a great place to work, but you should know what you want or you might end up working on things you don't like.
cons: Not much to do, if you're looking to be a software developer you won't have too many opportunities to program and code

review_title: Good place to learn, not to earn - a good retirement company
pros:
Good place to learn (slow pace). Good campus
Learn in and out of locomotives, sometimes u might get a chance to go onsite and perform testing on real locomotives.
cons:
No tools for testing, need to rely on printf statement
People who worked for years couldn't bring in new ideas in work rather follow traditional way.
No tool to measure employee's efficiency, productivity and would rather rely on English words to merely rate your performance.
Lot of process & politics, back stabbing.

review_title: Stable job
pros: Good learning opportunities. Good work life balance, work from home whenever need be, HSA, DFSA etc are good. They have an office almost any where in the world. Good support for new mothers.
cons: If you get stuck with a bad manager, there is nothing to save you. Raises are very less. No bonuses. Need to manage up, down sideways. If you accomplish one thing, you have to tell 20 people for it to get noticed.

review_title: Getting worse.   Just a cog in a massive wheel
job_title: Senior Mechanical Engineer in Atlanta, GA
pros: Fun job sometimes.   Travel is good.   Bennies are good
cons: Management doesn't know what it's doing.   Too many layers.   No promoting up through ranks.   HR has too much control and nepotism runs rampant in certain ethnic groups.

review_title: Many opportunities for growth
pros: If you have the skills and continue to agree to accept more responsibility, you can move up.
cons: You have to prove yourself for a quite a while before you can move up. You may also have to make opportunities for yourself rather than anyone handing them to you because you've excelled. Company culture of people who actually do the work is caught up in a lot of CYA--lots of employees scared of reprimand, etc...

review_title: A company with great itself marketing.
pros: Looks great on a resume due to its wide-spread brand recognition, lots of opportunity to work on high-pressure projects, great training in too-large bureaucracies and all the issues endemic to large-scale cultural rot from the inside
cons: Executive and Corporate management is self-absorbed with their personal reputation and selfish recognition, not necessarily what is right or good for customers.  Corporate truisms like "We are training future leaders" belies strong cultural age bias

review_title: Intern Summer 2013
pros: Great resume builder. Very good exposure. Great pay. Internship is offered to sophomores in addition to juniors. Definitely jump on this especially if you are a sophomore.
cons: The location is pretty horrendous, Erie Pennsylvania. A lot of the upper level staff were born and raised there so it's home for them. Despite that, huge intern community and there is a mediocre beach (on Lake Erie) nearby, so some thought it was one of the best summers they've ever had. Toxic upper-level work environment was not directly experienced at all but could be witnessed.

review_title: Technology co-op @ GE Appliances
job_title: Laundry Technology Co-op in Louisville, KY
pros: GE is working on a lot of projects which gives you a good opportunity to work for other functional teams if you talk to the right people. Always ask if there is anything else that your boss or another congruent functional team needs help with. If you have that attitude during your co-op you will get a great co-op experience. Co-ops are given a good hourly wage and a living stipend if coming from outside the louisville area.
cons: During some phases of development there is not too much to do.

review_title: GE is a great place to start out
pros: Training opportunities, flexible schedules, travel opportunities, reasonable salary for area, exciting projects to work on.  You will work with great people for the most part.
cons: As with most large companies, frustrating bureaucracy slows down / inhibits work.  Lots of office politics... more so recently than in the past.

review_title: Working at GE
pros: Good place to start a career and with many opportunities for career branching with the many different businesses under GE.
cons: Not many to point out besides the fact that it is a very large company.  If large companies isn't your thing then you might want to look elsewhere. Other than that there is nothing egregious to point out.

review_title: IT Analyst  5
pros: GE is a Top company in many fields, it is very respectful with people, it has a lot of values and opportunities for the people. GE is one of the most inclusive and open work environments you can find in a good company in the United States.
cons: Sometimes the management ideals are not the same from country to country, the tropicalized ideals tends to happen.

review_title: Enjoyed job only marginally better than living under an overpass
pros: Leading a very diverse group of people at site level.  Good location to sustain the downturn in the market.
cons: So many to mention.  Corporate politics, lack of executive leadership, too many corporate folks focusing on future internal career opportunities and not focusing on current job tasks.  Industry culture and customer focus are secondary to assimilating into GE culture.  Terrible business direction.  At times incredibly conservative, then one moment, completely unrealistic business expectations particularly in times with volatile futures prices.

review_title: Shop Floor Experience ERIE PA
pros: The company has very high integrity standards.  There is lots of room to grow and develop your career.  I feel respected in my position.
cons: The new (2015) performance rating system is vague.  When business is booming overtime becomes nearly mandatory for salary shop managers.  When a site down sizes they expect the remaining employees to "make it work."  Which can be very difficult.

review_title: Great Company - a bit schizophrenic
pros: Great emphasis on speed, innovation and digital transformation.  Leading the charge into the Industrial Internet of Things.
cons: Emphasis on speed not aligned with budget processes and support functions.  HR, Finance, Purchasing, etc. are incredibly bureaucratic and slow.  Suffers from a tendency to "inflate" achievements beyond actually delivered results at times.

review_title: Commercial Operations Manager
job_title: Commercial Operations Manager in Redmond, WA
pros:
- Management allows the participation and promotion of ideas.
- Great initiatives that promote working remotely.
- GE has great values that allow to deliver high-quality on products and services.
- They provide good IT equipment for work.
cons:
- Disruption is at the core of some businesses and there is change every three weeks, it is difficult to keep up.
- There are a lot of IT issues, which have a great impact of productivity.

review_title: Awsome company with great opportunities to train yourself
pros:
1. Good working environment
2. Freedom of expression
3.  Career Opportunities
4. Visionary executive leadership
cons:
1. Little differentiation in the role model and solid contributions
2. Too much process focused on several trivial things makes progress extremely slow
3. Compensation on the lower side but benefits and exposure do compensate to some extent

review_title: Worst company ever
pros: Food at the canteen is good! company was good since new management arrived.
cons: This is the worse company I saw in my life . It's totally a mess. The internal Service Desk is managed from people who really don't know how to manage a team. Full of stupid rules like asking in a chat for having a break. If you are late 3-5 minutes they send to you an email , if you finish late then they  don't mind. Knowledge is a mess. Really do not Apply! I still work here and can't wait to leave!

review_title: Good work environment and tech stack with its own drawbacks as any org
pros:
Awesome Techstack to work
Good package and benefits
cons:
Depends on project-your work life balance varies
Not all at your senior levels are good at coding which gives opportunity sometimes to showcase your skills and make you irritating sometimes as well coz u need to do everything which hits ur work life balance.

review_title: Not the best company to work for
pros: Good job if you are right out of school. They will give you the basics that you can use to find another job. It's managements fault, they will not try to keep you after they train you.
cons: bad management. bad pay. No growth oppurtunities. This location is run by incompetent management. They make promises and do not keep them. You get a raise every year and a half which is 3-5%. They seem to change their whole set of employees every 6-12 months because everyone is pissed. So again, only take this job if you are really desparate or this is your first job out of school. Please consider moving on after 6 months.

review_title: Had been a great company to work for, not sure if it still is...
job_title: Senior Hardware Engineer in Santa Clara, CA
pros: High compensation, cutting edge work and a good brand name.
cons: Graphics market is becoming increasingly competitive and even though Nvidia has been great in execution over past few years, it is going to get tough in future, especially with Intel and AMD becoming a competitive threat to Nvidia in the discrete graphics market.

review_title: Working for GE is like working at many other large companies.
pros: GE is a stable strong company to work for with jobs all over the world. GE provides good health and retirement benefits. GE has competent management.
cons: If you are not in management you get no bonuses, profit sharing, stock purchase plan or any other perks. Non-management workers work for a paycheck and a pension.

review_title: The best company ever
job_title: Maintenance Technician III  in Cincinnati, OH
pros:
Well, you can always choose someplace else to work, but we talk about the efficiency and the 
valuse for the customer and the employee, not to mention the fringe benefits, which you, of
course had to  pay for as part of your base salary.  Try to find out whats going on with the company for the long haul is the real issue...get laid before retirement is a real concern.
cons: Good people at first, but later on the people all start looking like the very first time.

review_title: Old Boy's Club
pros: Once you make a name for yourself it is a fun place. Engineers have a lot of freedom to play with technology. Some of the subject matter is very interesting. Pay is pretty good.
cons: Paperwork for everything, Online training for everything. They are trying to turn every job into a manual. Every decision flows through 2 or three top level engineers so if you are a young engineer you better get good at presentations and taking criticism. Tons of EGO.

review_title: Great!
job_title: Global Sourcing Intern in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Plenty of opportunity. Good project selection. Lots of freedom to explore and present ideas for growth. The management team is awesome and the company has plenty of room for advancement.
cons: I don't k ow if it's necessarily a bad thong, but GE really pressures its employees to stick around. Once they invest in you they want you to be there to invest your knowledge in the company.

review_title: Tons of options in a great company
pros:
- Healthcare benefits are good (but they used to be a bit less expensive)
- Pay is fair
- Amazing opportunities to move from one company within GE to another while retaining your years of service and benefits
cons:
- LARGE organization that is a bit slow to change at times
- some of the business units are rather political in how they are run (Supply Chain)

review_title: Good
pros: Great company with a lot of great people. The network is still one of the best. It connects GE employees from all over the globe. Promotions and advancement is still available for those who are smart and hard working.
cons: Health benefits have been getting worse and worse over the years. Cutback are everywhere. And once they are cut, it never comes back. Work enviroment is also getting more policatical.

review_title: positive and constantly being pushed to better myself.
pros: Training g courses and learning programs constantly pushed on employees enable professional growth. Most are relevant and really do help
cons: getting so big you no longer speak to anybody -- "workflow" procedures dictate all purchasing, decision making activities, contracts. Very cumbersome and time delaying to accounts

review_title: Global Corporate Giant with Advantages and Disadvantages
pros: Lots of exposure if you want it. Many resources to help you grow. Learning, HR. Support and giving the opportunity to move around the world and meet some great people. GE could be a country by itself.
cons: Constantly changing corporate environment. You need to understand this to be able to move with the company and grow with it.

review_title: Early Career Growth
pros: Good focus on training and development in early portion of career as a young engineer. Technical development programs are very challenging but worth the time and effort.
cons: Very long product development cycle. For a yong engineer it takes a long time to see multiple design cycles full-circle.

review_title: Operations Director
pros:
GE is a great organization! A company with great reputation and integrity!
The meritocracy here is real and all the leaders take it in consideration for promotions and recognition.
We also have a great portfolio of products that add value to our clients and community!
cons:
High level positions are filled with expats. International career outside the region became a challenge.
The local executives have no empowerment and the position is not so porwefull than in the past (lack of empowerment, poor trainings and limited opportunties).

review_title: Great company for entry-level hires, leadership programs are best in business.
pros: Came in as a college hire into one of the leadership programs. The development you get in the program is top notch. GE is known for its leadership programs and it's a tremendous career accelerator.
cons: Working with a global audience has pros/cons. You might not move as quickly as you would with people from your country, but a great learning experience none the less.

review_title: Good and bad, depends on division
pros: Incredibly smart people, most are trying to do the right thing. Leadership training is the best in the world, and there are lots of opportunities.
cons: Finance people get way too much say in business decisions, and the culture of meetings and processes is paralyzing at times. When the business hits a snag, the playbook is to cut costs, rather than try to grow out of the problem. Very short-term focused on the quarter.

review_title: GE Great Place to work
job_title: Lead Software Architect in Melbourne, FL
pros: I work at GE and it is a great place to work. I have no complaints as of today.
cons: GE will not hire very experienced people in particular areas for very strange reasons. I don't understand why they do this.

review_title: GE Motors
job_title: Human Resources Leader in Monterrey, Nuevo León
pros: A company with good results, a lot of work to do and improve, good products, market leader in motors manufacturing, quality, etc.
cons: They have a very bad culture, employees are stressed almost all the time. Leaders yell and ofend their employees when things are not made the way they think should be done. If some leaders don´t like an employee they do everything they can to make him quit by pushing him/her to do things they don´t want to do.

review_title: Inspection
pros: Good pay and benefits package. Decent retirement benefits and 401k. Clean work environment air conditioning. Good coworkers.
cons: Very poor management and leadership. Very poor planning to keep the work flow moving through the shop. There is no real supervison of the work force and a lot of the good old boy culture.

review_title: Old guard, will not change
pros: Good to be working for a technology company.  Jeff Immelt makes all the difference.
cons: Too politically motivated environment.  Every leader sheds his/her natural skin at the doors of GE office and puts on the 'politically correct' exterior coming into the workplace.  The racism exists in a very grey shade, something no one dares to point out.  US is still the leader, master.  Others' thought process doesn't count.

review_title: With production halted at Erie Facility, layoff are imminent
pros: Fantastic Co-workers. Strong teams. Pays well
cons: Poor Health Benefits. Poor Work/Life Balance. "It's not what you know, but who you know" type of place. Program Managers are a diverse group. Some great, most are mediocre, the rest are completely worthless.  Eng Mgt is very disjointed when it comes to common vision. One says left, the other says right.

review_title: Not what it once was
pros: Good for resume, great co-workers
cons: Declining raises / compensation, declining focus on quality & the customer.  The general process is that people who are mediocre are promoted to get rid of them, if you are competent then they have no interest in letting you move up and having to replace you.

review_title: Services
pros:
- I work with a handful of smart people.
- This business segment generates cash, so it feels comparatively stable vs some other GE segments.
cons:
- The company focuses efforts almost exclusively on internal-facing metrics.
- Recruiting and retention is abysmal. Employees are either >10yrs and stalled out or <1.5 looking for other work.
- Upcoming merger with an even worse company.
- Preach culture of integrity but the only initiatives supported by leadership are those to juke stats.
- Under SEC investigation.
- Stale and uninspiring corporate culture.

review_title: Looks great on your resume
pros: Good benefits, global company, generally smart people work there, lots of opportunity if you are willing to move and be flexible. Good opportunities for training and personal development. Good recognition of brand and company and adds lots of credibility to your resume.
cons: Work-life balance can be difficult, lots of bureaucracy, type-A personality dominates. Sometimes it can seem as if certain people are "chosen" to be successful and are then coddled and promoted regardless of their performance.

review_title: Big is not always beautiful
pros:
The always steep learning curve. I enjoy taking new and challenging assignments in this company.
This company also offers flexibility of switching to different jobs within the company.
People are very  nice to each other.
cons:
GE is a bit too big and sometimes not as competent as smaller companies in decision making.
GE is

review_title: GE - A good career starter
pros: GE is a great place to work for someone who is looking to work in a results driven company.  They give you the opportunity to excel and will give you the tools needed whether it is additional training or management support.
cons: The size of GE can make one feel seperated from the other areas within the organization as well as the actual operations itself.

review_title: Former GE employee
pros: Ge provides an excellent atmosphere to grow your career and learn best practices.  The training is second to none and I would recommend the company to anyone.
cons: GE can be overwhelming at first.  If you are not used to seeking out information or opportunities for improvement, then GE is not the place for you.

review_title: good place to learn and grow
job_title: Mechanical Engineer Intern in Niskayuna, NY
pros: Lots of best experts to learn from, best training system in industry, best industrial research center. lots of interesting research projects.  Good growth in management, presentation skills,  in addition to technical growth.
cons:
heavy work load. 
the location of GRC is not ideal to me, cold and long winter with heavy snow.

review_title: GE is a good place to work, if you are willing to work hard.
pros:
Flexibility - if you get your work finished and are a high performer, you can manage your own time
Volunteerism - GE does a good job of giving back to the community
cons: Wall Street analyst and pressure to provide good earnings can lead to cost cutting.  These are sometimes at the expense of making the best long-term decisions.

review_title: Very Rewarding and a chance to work with very smart people and the resources to make positive changes
pros: Many resources and great people that are encouraged to be the best and will support you at any means so you will be successful
cons: Sometimes being in such a large company promotions are hard to atttain especially depending on the industry your in, hower movement and experience is a plus

review_title: Powerful company with a lot of creativity
pros: GE is a very well known company and holds a lot of power in the world.  Creative and innovative.  Definitely a great resume builder.
cons: Only problem I experienced was the 1,2,3 rating system where everyone is rated on this scale with a very low salary percentage increase each year.

review_title: ok, but other better companies out there
pros: good work/family balance is good, that's about it. Good company if you're trying to be a corporate person, but if you just want to be just so, then look else where. I guess everything else is ok
cons: promotion is based on who likes you rather than your performance. They are not good when you want to refer friends/family to a position.I havent really had a good experience working with them in the 5-6 years I've been affilitated with the company

review_title: GE is a great place to work!  The freedom and opportunity to drive your own career!
pros: Tremendous freedom to develop career path, Great Technical Expertise, Challenging problems, Great industry, Opportunities, Competitive Salary, Strong Senior Leadership, Awesome Training,
cons: A bit heavy on the beauracracy.  Things can take a while to develop.  There can be some frustration with the slow pace.  A big company can often get in the way of its own progress.

review_title: 6 years in GE Energy Air Filtration Sourcing Organization
pros: Good compensation relative to other companies, constant training, high expectations.  Very much enjoyed co-workers and my cross-functional team.
cons:
Our small business has had 4 different General Managers in my 6 years - I've had 3 different direct managers in the same time.  Thus the vision and path to achieve it has changed pretty radicaly multiple times.

Only as our office is closing is there any real interest to deeplu understand what I do and how I do it.

review_title: "OK" Company but very bureaucratic and chaotic
pros:
Exceptional benefits such as pension, shares scheme, insurance, health incentives...
Challenging work.
cons:
Significantly below market salary and extremely low salary increment.
You can climb fast if you are in managerial or executive role.
Managers and leaders move every year or two, hence there is no ownership of actions.
Need to change post every year or two if you want promotion.
On a cost-saving rampage but wasting cost at obvious places.
Unrealistic project planning and expectation.
Incongruent actions relative to what are saying from the top management.
Any process are heavily bureaucratic and full of red tapes.

review_title: Best Company to work with!
pros: GE is definitely the place to mould yourself with the culture, integrity and organised structure and practices. The trainings are the best to ensure 100% utilization and learning for an employee. Integrity and the culture have always been open and very easy to understand. It's a great start up place to develop your skills, talent and understand what career path you are looking for.
cons: The salary could be higher compared to the job market. There are a lot of incentives, but the basic salary is pretty less.

review_title: Excellent Opportunity for Internships
pros: GE Transportation offers a great work environment. The people are friendly and make a great team.  They had a good mentorship program which had you reporting to a single engineer to learn and obtain work projects that could easily build up your skills.  The life-work balance was excellent..
cons: Some of the tasks could become repetitive and you could get yourself pigeon-holed into only doing a certain type of task if you don't actively seek out new challenges and responsibilities.

review_title: ITLP at GE
pros: exposure to leadership, training, good pay
cons: big company so there is a lot of bureaucracy, locations could be better

review_title: Great experience
pros: It a great place to work, because you are exposed to vast technologies and a lot of subject matter experts that you can learn from to further you career.  Also, the company has a great set of values.
cons: Since it is a large corporation, there is a lot of bureaucracy when trying to get your job done.  Also, executives are very demanding, and due to this reason their is a poor work/life balance on entry level and mid-level managers.

review_title: Awesome opportunity.  Great company.
job_title: Technical Project Engineer in Wilmington, NC
pros: Great town.  Minutes from the beach and 2 hrs south of  Raleigh, NC.  Great management and the teams are very helpful.
cons: Seems to be a bit of clique-ish.  They have their circle of engineers they know and trust and then there is all the rest trying to get in the "inner circle".

review_title: Program Mgr.  RETIRED
pros: GE Aerospace -- now no longer part of GE -- was technologically at the cutting edge of what we did.  Management focus, tracking progress, and support of their employees was very good.
cons: GE Aerospace would cut our budget requests by 5 to 15 percent but still require the same output.  Therefore we routinely requested more funds than might be needed to compensate for the expected shortfall in funding.  It was a stupid game, but we were good -- out of necessity -- at playing it.

review_title: analyst
pros: great way to gain experience and plenty of room for advancement whether in my field or in another part of the company
cons: Long hours and the environment can be cutthroat.  It would be better to have more opportunity to learn instead of having to feel anxious about my job and if I'll be able to succeed over my coworkers

review_title: So far very satisfied- learned a lot and have grown
job_title: Engineering Technical Leader in Greenville, SC
pros: Many opportunities to contribute and grow your career.  Hard work is recognized. Flexible work schedule can be arranged. No hard limit on vacation days as long as you complete your responsibilities
cons: Too many reviews and pressure to save cost; going back to old culture when we're not fast and nimble. Management tends to promote Engineers who are hired in the Edison track versus who aren't

review_title: Great start to a career but not for long term growth
pros:
- Huge community of really smart people - if you put yourself out there, you can learn a lot and make great connections. 
- Challenging and demanding environment forces you to learn and learn quickly
cons:
- Difficult to move quickly within GE. 
- Sales culture tends to be very "old school." 
- Some lack of diversity in terms of peer experience.

review_title: General Consultant
job_title: General Consultant in Lehigh Acres, FL
pros: Very friendly coworkers, worked at your own pace with minimal interruptions a lot of employees brought head phone sets and listened to music while they worked, casual dress and great pay.  Always had luncheons, pizza parties, and employee events.  They give their employees optional Fridays off during summertime so they can be home with their kids but of course take their work home.
cons: Employees seemed to be overworked a lot of them would take their work home with them.

review_title: Service Leader
job_title: Service Leader in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: The people, the benefits and the culture at GE is great. GE has been doing a great job to drive a successful business while becoming a company that truly cares about  their employees.
cons: While there is always a need to evaluate workforce to ensure operational effectiveness, efficiency, and cost savings, it occurs more often than preferred. 2 - 3 times a year on a year over year basis. It is only fair to state that this is just not GE specific, this is happening across the entire healthcare/medical device industry.

review_title: Energy Connections - Quality Intern (OMLP)
pros:
The people and environment is great! Everyone is busy, yet they are still happy to stop and help you! Additionally, as an intern you are not just given busy-work projects. I worked in the manufacturing plant, and the projects I were given had a big impact on the company. 

I value my time I had with GE!
cons: I worked approximately 10 - 13 hours per day.  It wasn't mandatory to work over-time, but my projects required me to stay in the plant longer than 8 hours.

review_title: Not the GE everyone knows
pros: Brand name has great value, GE has its age and maturity in certain aspects such as ethics and culture.
cons: GE is a massive company, and every business has its own experience. Rating GE as a whole is difficult. From the Engineering perspective, GE is no longer the innovator it used to be in the 1980s. After GE exited the "technology" arena into "capital", the engineering legacy was dispersed and lost in its divestures and closures.

review_title: GE
job_title: Senior Technical Manager in Orlando, FL
pros: Flexibility (work from home, part time), good experience, talented people.
cons: GE is going through some major cost cutting right now.

review_title: GE will fail due to hiring and promotion tactics
pros: The pros are probably the benefits, but that is pretty much it.
cons: The company is selling off and going down hill, but if anyone has been to their Twitter page you can see they aren't interested in the best candidates but are interested in unethical "progressive" hiring practices.  Instead of building up current employees who have passion to work ahead, they hire inexperienced colleges graduates and hire exclusively to meet  "diversity" instead of the best which are usually people already within the company that started from the bottom.

review_title: Human Resources
pros: Amazing products, truly global organisation. Very smart and hardworking people, definitely opportunities to develop leadership (subject to mobility), Would absolutely recommend, its such a great learning curve.
cons: Can feel like a small fish in a big ocean at times, business can be a bit cut throat with  massive decision made quickly e.g. to sell business segments off. You need to push for your own career development

review_title: Due to poor financial position, GE is struggling and the environment is toxic.
job_title: Senior Director Engineering in San Ramon, CA
pros: Large company experience, globally distributed company with many opportunities. Exposure to multiple industries and business units. Potential for future growth is there if they can address failed financial decisions.
cons: Constant change, lack of direction and clear goals and objectives makes for a challenging environment.  The culture is not great and the environment is depressing.

review_title: Materials Specialist
pros: Flexible Family time, prorated vacation days,  not micro managed,
cons: Promises not kept,  computer training on things that didn't pertain to job site which would take hours and days to complete.   not enough man power to not cause conflict if someone was off or called in sick or to cover work loads. No real pay increases.

review_title: Engineer
pros: Challenging work. New technologies being pursued. Benefits not too bad but I’ve seen companies with better. Product line is exciting to watch being built.
cons: Horrible management. Very short sighted. Only looks out one quarter when making big cost-cutting decisions.  GE lied when they said that they will have 20,000 women in technology roles by 2020. With men in the management positions, women are overlooked for promotions or the first one out the door when layoffs occur. I even heard a male manager say that he thinks that women don’t want to work. The culture is toxic.

review_title: Year Long Internship
pros: I had a great level of responsibility. I had a very supportive manager and mentor that helped me to succeed. It was brilliant working for such a well renown company. There were opportunities to do volunteer work as well which looks great on my CV.
cons: The company is so big there is a sense of divide between the different departments and you only really have the opportunity to speak to people in your own department. You don't get a very detailed understanding of what the other departments on site do.

review_title: GE's a good starter for a career moving forward
pros: Huge company gives lots of opportunity to try many different areas. If you work in a certain area for a while, you can try a completely different type of work within the same company, same pension, etc. By staying within the same company you can keep your seniority while trying to advance your career in different ways.
cons: Since it's such a large company, you can find yourself in lots of bureaucracy.

review_title: GE Energy, tough reliable job that pushes your limits.
job_title: IT Program Manager in Atlanta, GA
pros: Stability -- harder you work,  the more you take upon yourself, the more you're rewarded.  Pension.
cons: It's a big company.  If you're looking for a smaller feel, this is not the place for you.  You have to prove yourself everyday or you'll be swallowed by the beast.

review_title: Great internship in project management
pros: GE is not afraid to stack on the responsibility, the amount of experience from this internship is pretty serious. I've learned a lot about being a professional.
cons: Material can sometimes be a bit dull, but the great thing about IMLP is you can start somewhere fresh in 6 months. Also it's a little tough to move from business to business.

review_title: It was a painful but worthy experience.
pros: Great place to get some real hands on industrial experience. The engineering problems are extremely challenging and rewarding. GE is great for new hires to settle down and grow within the company.
cons: Nothing gets done correctly. Instead of sucking it up and solving the problems, they tend to patch a solution and leave the problem for the next unlucky group of engineers.

review_title: Lovely
pros: Friendly supervisors, weekends off ,decent starting salary,many raises,huge opportunitites to advance yourself within the company,and a work schedule that fits everyones needs.
cons: Not the best benefits package available,some jobs are very dirty and noisy,The on the job training could be more clear. You are shown what to do but a lot of the times why you have to do it a certain way.

review_title: GE
pros:
Excellent career development environment. 
Vast resources spent on employee development. 
Preference is given to individuals that join GE through their corporate programs, especially a combination of FMP and CAS will definetly give an individual a fast-track career. 
GE is an excellent name to carry in your CV.
cons:
Quite bureaucratic and decisions often depending on US HQ. 
Despite that the growth of revenues comes from outside US there are few non-US senior executives.

review_title: Enjoyed the challenge but management felt clueless
pros: MNC experience and if in the right team, access to resources and opportunities is worth it. It all depends which team and how good at employee management the manager is.
cons: Performance appraisal system is one of the worst I have ever come across. Again it's all with how knowledgeable the manager is to determine how rewarding the experience is.

review_title: Great Managers
pros: The engineering management team was amazing to work with.  Some of the most intelligent and competent people I've ever worked with.
cons: The purchasing and accounting systems made it almost impossible to get vendors into the system and pay them once they were in.  All of the vendor support was in India and they would always refer me to the same website which was never able to help.  I couldn't get the lab equipment I needed because I couldn't pay the vendors.

review_title: GE is a great company to work for especially starting out as an intern or co-op. I'm glad I have the opportunity
job_title: I T Systems Engineer Co-op in Van Buren Township, MI
pros: Team based environment, opportunity for advancement, opportunity to grow and develop professionally, Celebration of Diversity and culture, great pay for interns and co-ops
cons: Atmosphere can be too laid back and boring, over hear about people getting laid off often

review_title: Generator Specialist
pros: I worked in the factory 16 yrs and for the international dept. 18 yrs. Excellent pay, travel, great working environment.
cons: Upper management cares only for the bottom line. Schenectady went from 36,000 employees in 1980 to around 4,000 now. No longer has a pension plan other than 401Ks. Threw 56,000 salaried retirees into a health exchange this year and hourly retirees next. WAS a good place to work.
